title: Charli XCX Drops Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat: Stream
description: The star-studded remix album offers new takes on the album that captured the zeitgeist this summer. Charli XCX Drops Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat: Stream Mary Siroky
author: Mary Siroky
excerpt: Charli XCX has unveiled Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat, the star-studded remix version of her acclaimed 2024 album.
text: Charli XCX has unveiled Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat, a remix version of her 2024 smash LP. The stacked take on Brat features the previously released remixes: “Von dutch” with A.G. Cook and Addison Rae, “360” with Robyn and Yung Lean, the “Girl, so confusing” remix with Lorde, “Guess” with Billie Eilish, and “Talk Talk” featuring Troye Sivan. The project is rounded out by reimagined versions of all the other songs on Brat, including a new take on “Sympathy is a knife” with Ariana Grande and “I might say something stupid” with The 1975, where her fiancé, George Daniel, serves as drummer. Get Charli XCX Tickets Here The album also welcomes Bon Iver for one of the more introspective songs on the LP, “I think about it all the time.” Longtime collaborator A.G. Cook also appears on the new version of “So I,” while Consequence CoSign alum The Japanese House can be found on the new take on “Apple.” Other tracks feature The Strokes’ Julian Casablancas, Caroline Polachek, Robyn, and Tinashe. Charli XCX is in the midst of her ongoing “Sweat” tour with Troye Sivan, an incredibly high-energy outing that’s proven to be one of the best pop events of the year; read our review here. This weekend, XCX and Sivan are slated to hit Denver and Phoenix, and shows along the West Coast are still on the horizon. Look for deals and grab last-minute tickets here. While imagery around Brat has become one of the defining visual trends of 2024, Charli XCX recently revealed that the low-budget look was just that — a move to save money. Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat Artwork: Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat Tracklist: 01. 360 featuring robyn & yung lean 02. Club classics featuring BB Trickz 03. Sympathy is a knife featuring ariana grande 04. I might say something stupid featuring the 1975 & jon hopkins 05. Talk talk featuring troye sivan 06. Von dutch a. g. cook remix featuring addison rae 07. Everything is romantic featuring caroline polachek 08. Rewind featuring bladee 09. So I featuring a.g. cook 10. Girl, so confusing featuring lorde 11. Apple featuring the japanese house 12. B2b featuring tinashe 13. Mean girls featuring julian casablancas 14. I think about it all the time featuring bon iver 15. 365 featuring shygirl 16. Guess featuring billie eilish Charli XCX 2024 Tour Dates: 10/11 — Denver, CO @ Ball Arena 10/13 — Phoenix, AZ @ Footprint Center 10/15 — Los Angeles, CA @ Kia Forum 10/16 — Los Angeles, CA @ Kia Forum 10/18 — San Diego, CA @ Viejas Arena 10/20 — San Francisco, CA @ Chase Center 10/22 — Portland, OR @ Moda Center 10/23 — Seattle, WA @ Climate Pledge Arena 11/27 — Manchester, UK @ Co-op Live Arena 11/28 — London, UK @ The O2 11/29 — Birmingham, UK @ Resorts World Arena 12/02 — Glasgow, UK @ OVO Hydro Arena
html:
Charli XCX has unveiled Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat, a remix version of her 2024 smash LP.

The stacked take on Brat features the previously released remixes: “Von dutch” with A.G. Cook and Addison Rae, “360” with Robyn and Yung Lean, the “Girl, so confusing” remix with Lorde, “Guess” with Billie Eilish, and “Talk Talk” featuring Troye Sivan. The project is rounded out by reimagined versions of all the other songs on Brat, including a new take on “Sympathy is a knife” with Ariana Grande and “I might say something stupid” with The 1975, where her fiancé, George Daniel, serves as drummer.

Get Charli XCX Tickets Here

The album also welcomes Bon Iver for one of the more introspective songs on the LP, “I think about it all the time.” Longtime collaborator A.G. Cook also appears on the new version of “So I,” while Consequence CoSign alum The Japanese House can be found on the new take on “Apple.” Other tracks feature The Strokes’ Julian Casablancas, Caroline Polachek, Robyn, and Tinashe.

Charli XCX is in the midst of her ongoing “Sweat” tour with Troye Sivan, an incredibly high-energy outing that’s proven to be one of the best pop events of the year; read our review here. This weekend, XCX and Sivan are slated to hit Denver and Phoenix, and shows along the West Coast are still on the horizon. Look for deals and grab last-minute tickets here.

While imagery around Brat has become one of the defining visual trends of 2024, Charli XCX recently revealed that the low-budget look was just that — a move to save money.

Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat Artwork:

Brat and it’s completely different but also still brat Tracklist:
01. 360 featuring robyn & yung lean
02. Club classics featuring BB Trickz
03. Sympathy is a knife featuring ariana grande
04. I might say something stupid featuring the 1975 & jon hopkins
05. Talk talk featuring troye sivan
06. Von dutch a. g. cook remix featuring addison rae
07. Everything is romantic featuring caroline polachek
08. Rewind featuring bladee
09. So I featuring a.g. cook
10. Girl, so confusing featuring lorde
11. Apple featuring the japanese house
12. B2b featuring tinashe
13. Mean girls featuring julian casablancas
14. I think about it all the time featuring bon iver
15. 365 featuring shygirl
16. Guess featuring billie eilish

Charli XCX 2024 Tour Dates:

10/13 — Phoenix, AZ @ Footprint Center

12/02 — Glasgow, UK @ OVO Hydro Arena
